project.name: Poseidon Networking
project.scope: Zero-trust networking, mTLS, service mesh policy

sections.title: Introduction & Role Context
sections.goal: Understand the Security Engineer’s background, current responsibilities, and how they intersect with UX in the Poseidon Networking project.
sample_questions: Can you briefly describe your role and daily responsibilities in the Poseidon Networking project?
How does your security work integrate with the service mesh policy design?
From your perspective, how do security requirements influence user or developer experience in our environment?

sections.title: Security-UX Intersections
sections.goal: Explore how security measures like mTLS and zero-trust impact operational workflows and user interactions.
sample_questions: What are the most common friction points developers encounter when working with mTLS configurations?
How have you balanced the POL-SEC-001 Least Privilege & JIT Access policy with usability for internal teams?
Can you share an example where security configuration impacted API performance or reliability?

sections.title: Incident Response & Runbooks
sections.goal: Dive into operational practices, referencing runbooks and tickets, and how they guide decision-making during incidents.
sample_questions: Could you walk me through RB-NET-029 Cert Rotation Checklist and its role in preventing outages?
Have you experienced a situation where a runbook needed rapid updates during an incident? What triggered that?
How does our incident evidence gathering support both security audit requirements and UX improvements?

sections.title: Cross-Project Dependencies
sections.goal: Identify links between Poseidon Networking and other Novereon projects, especially those affecting security posture and UX.
sample_questions: How does Poseidon Networking integrate with Aegis IAM for authentication?
Have you coordinated with Nimbus Observability to monitor security-related SLOs?
Can you describe a scenario where a change in one project required adjustments in Poseidon Networking?

sections.title: Decision-Making & Risk Trade-offs
sections.goal: Understand how the engineer evaluates trade-offs between strict security controls and operational efficiency.
sample_questions: When deciding mTLS policy levels (RFC-1618), what factors guide you beyond compliance?
Have you faced situations where reducing the BLAST_RADIUS conflicted with latency targets?
What evidence do you typically present to justify security-related trade-offs to stakeholders?

sections.title: Future Improvements & Closing
sections.goal: Gather insights on potential improvements in security measures and their UX implications.
sample_questions: If you could change one aspect of our current zero-trust implementation, what would it be and why?
Are there upcoming technologies or methods you believe could improve both our security posture and user experience?
What’s one lesson from Poseidon Networking you’d share with a new Security Engineer joining the company?
